sentence: Then the second one is, assuming that the startup is actually starting to sell their product, how do you scale that into a mature business? And that again, is another specific skill

author: A
sentence: Now that skill is quite often also needed as you grow a normal business, so a normal other organisation, so it's not just the startup, but it is very specific to a startup, it is always needed by a startup

author: A
sentence: It may not always be needed by another Board

author: A
sentence: In a more kind of mature environment, Boards need to have a much better understanding of people, of their customers and of their technology and operating models

author: A
sentence: If you get those four aspects working together, then you ought to be able to navigate the destructing world that we live in

author: Q
sentence: So you haven't mentioned things like law, because often the Boards I've been interviewing, they've got a lawyer and they've got accountants, so you're saying -

author: A
sentence: Yeah, I think that was the past, and I don't think it is completely gone away for sure, because there's nothing wrong with having - I'm a Chartered Accountant, so part of my ability or benefit to a Board is that yeah, I do understand financial, but I've spent much more time in the destructive space, understanding how business models work and how that technology play can be adapted, used, or be a problem for an organisation

author: A
sentence: So that side of it needs to be parked there as well

author: A
sentence: Yes, there are definitely situations where - but you can always buy in legal services, it's more the ability to identify that there is a potential or a problem, to enable to actually access the expertise as required

author: A
sentence: Now if the Board was going through significant acquisitions or something, then you'd expect a Board member to have experience with that

author: A
sentence: It could be adapting a Board according to the activities of the business

author: Q
sentence: With Board diversity then, fitting in here, how important do you think that is? Let's say one is not important at all, and 10 is extremely important

author: A
sentence: I think it'd be extremely important, but not in the diversity that we probably think

author: A
sentence: I think the diversity of thinking that is the most important factor, and yes, diversity of thinking comes with normal diversity as well, so if you get different genders, you get different country of origins, et cetera, you will end up with a natural diversity of thinking

author: A
sentence: But it's probably even more important to make sure you don't have your Type A personality sitting on a Board, even if they are female and male

author: A
sentence: That quite often happens

author: A
sentence: Any successful business person has got a little bit of Type A in them, if not a lot

author: A
sentence: So being able to identify that, and even do things within a Board discussion to highlight different things that we might be thinking about

author: Q
sentence: So one's a listed Board? One listed, and the others are

author: A
sentence: One of the Boards - the not-for-profit that I Chair, we use a diversity of thinking story, I guess, where depending on the situation, we all try and adopt the community face, and what would the community think of what we're about to decide

author: A
sentence: Then we try and adopt a kind of financial side, and then a risk side, and then our own people side, so we're all sort of forcing ourselves to think beyond what we would normally come into that room with, and see whether or not that changes our views on what we're about to decide

author: A
sentence: We just around the table on that basis and what we've found a number of times, is it has changed our decision because we've able to see it through a different eye, we see it with different lenses kind of thing

author: A
sentence: And that's, in my mind, a diversity of thinking

author: A
sentence: Now like I said, it does come more naturally if you have different gender, different race and different backgrounds, even different religions

author: A
sentence: All of those aspects do bring an element of that to the table, but sometimes you have to force it to create that situation

author: Q
sentence: That's really interesting

author: Q
sentence: How long have you been using this Participant 34D, this way of being -

author: A
sentence: Ever since I was the Chair, so two and a half years

author: Q
sentence: Did you introduce that strategy?

author: A
sentence: Yeah-no, absolutely

author: A
sentence: It's based on one of the partners at Deloitte that I worked with quite a bit, a lady by the name of Juliet Bourke

author: A
sentence: She's written a book on the diversity of thinking

author: A
sentence: I honestly don't know what the name of the book is though

author: Q
sentence: That's okay, was it B-U-R-K-E, or B-O

author: A
sentence: B-O-U-R-K-E, yeah

author: A
sentence: Juliet Bourke

author: Q
sentence: B-O-U-R-K-E

author: Q
sentence: I might check it out

author: A
sentence: Yeah, I'm pretty sure that's the name

author: A
sentence: Now you've made me think

author: A
sentence: I'll confirm that for you in a sec

author: Q
sentence: Oh lovely, thank you

author: Q
sentence: So you introduced this tool about two and a half years ago, did you see - you didn't see how the Board made decisions before you became Chair?

author: A
sentence: Well one's a not-for-profit, and one is an advisory board to a startup

author: A
sentence: No

author: Q
sentence: Have you got feedback from the Board members, how they find it?

author: A
sentence: Yeah

author: A
sentence: Yeah, they find it good

author: A
sentence: We probably don't recognise that we're doing it anymore

author: A
sentence: We just do, we just go, 'What would our community think? Let's put a risk hat on, let's think about the risks that we're talking about here

author: A
sentence: Anybody got any risks that they would like to identify?' just picking it up within the natural discussion

author: A
sentence: But yeah, it's one of the things where maybe we should call it out more often

author: Q
sentence: I'm just wondering, is there any situation where you think you just wouldn't worry about diversity, that it's not so important?

author: A
sentence: No

author: Q
sentence: any types of positions or situations?

author: A
sentence: No-no

author: Q
sentence: Nope?

author: A
sentence: No-no, never

author: A
sentence: Never

author: A
sentence: But not diversity by forcing three females and three males

author: Q
sentence: No

author: Q
sentence: The way you're talking about it, yeah

author: Q
sentence: Great, okay

author: Q
sentence: Good, you span the spectrum for us, which is good

author: Q
sentence: [laughter] It's useful given that - because I have questions, but what I tend to do is let you talk and I just tick off the questions that you answer as you go

author: Q
sentence: So you can compare, you know, contrast the different situations, that would be great, while we work through these questions

author: Q
sentence: You've told me how many, how long have you been sitting on these Boards for?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, it's more to get real diversity

author: A
sentence: In my mind, that's kind of a start, but if all you're trying to do is just give it an optical view, then you're probably not really making any impact because more than likely, you're choosing females who look and sound like yourself to be Board members, so you actually haven't got any diversity at all, really

author: Q
sentence: Okay, so what about social networks, do you think they matter?

author: A
sentence: For Boards?

author: Q
sentence: Yeah

author: A
sentence: Yeah

author: A
sentence: In what form? How do you mean 'do they matter'?

author: Q
sentence: Bringing in different - like having diverse social networks, does that benefit the Board, that kind of diversity? So you've got people that have links with particular communities that might be useful, or countries, or industries?

author: A
sentence: Sure, yeah

author: A
sentence: I don't have any reason why not and I couldn't think that it would be a problem

author: A
sentence: It would be a benefit for sure

author: A
sentence: I think today's world, the way we kind of talk about things, there is so much data out there today that most people can't anymore, get to the bottom of the details, what might be possible

author: A
sentence: For example: if we were looking to introduce a chat bot into our call centres at iSelect, we couldn't possibly examine every option available

author: A
sentence: There's so many that we would never get to the bottom of making a decision

author: A
sentence: Today's decision world is no longer at the detailed level

author: A
sentence: When I grew up, we could go down to the detail, to the cent if you like, and check something, then verify it three times and therefore tick it off as approved

author: A
sentence: You can't do that anymore, so the behaviour, particularly of millennials who have never had the experience I've had, is to skim, skim all the data and to use social trends to verify whether or the information they're seeing is good or bad

author: A
sentence: 'Good and bad' is probably not the right words, but better or worse in that situation

author: A
sentence: So what you're actually finding is that peer reviewing and trends are important elements for making decisions, and to be able to do that, you have to be tapped into the social networks out there, so you need to be across what's going on, say in Twitter and other things like that, to be able to manage your organisation either to respond to situations which may be negative, or to take opportunities that may be positive, or even to benchmark or make a decision about which way a business should go, based on their customers who might be trending or whatever

author: A
sentence: So the need to be more socially aware than we've ever been before, is very true and on that basis, Board members can't sit back in their club rooms and ignore the external factors like that, they have to be very much across it

author: A
sentence: Does that make sense?

author: Q
sentence: Yeah, that's really interesting

author: Q
sentence: It makes sense because I have this view of now, we've got this skimming, you've got to have filters, and so you're using lenses as perspectives and then you're also using social media and understanding of trends within social media to filter

author: Q
sentence: So decision making is very much at an executive level, using filters

author: A
sentence: Yep

author: A
sentence: That's really because you just can't get to the data

author: A
sentence: Something like the number of - I can't remember, I think Google's probably something like this that says, 'We've created more data in the last two years than has ever, ever been created ever before

author: A
sentence: ' So how could you possibly get across all of that data?

author: A
sentence: So the not-for-profit, for about two and a half years and I'm the Chair of that not-for-profit

author: A
sentence: My generation has grown up knowing that we could get to the detail

author: A
sentence: We know we can go down to the level of the cent and we can verify

author: A
sentence: You can no longer do that

author: A
sentence: When I grew up choosing a system, you'd have four accounting systems you chose between and you mad your choice of one of those four accounting systems, and you knew they were the four accounting systems you had to choose

author: A
sentence: You knew what each one of them did, you knew what the other one didn't do, et cetera

author: A
sentence: Now if you were trying to adopt some technology into your business, you have thousands of options

author: A
sentence: You couldn't possibly sit there and examine all of them to the detail we used to, or otherwise you'd still be doing this five years after the customer had forgotten that idea and moved on

author: A
sentence: So you have to adapt quickly with information that is not as robust as we probably previously had, and therefore we're using trends

author: A
sentence: It's kind of like my kids muck around with their Uber scores, they know their Uber scores better than mine and all this sort of stuff

author: A
sentence: And that's the way they're ranking themselves, according to their ranking in a feedback market

author: Q
sentence: I'm having connections in my head with Agile, because I've been interviewing some startup people who are very into Agile and it's a bit like that

author: Q
sentence: It's iterative riding the wave and interpreting the signs quickly

author: A
sentence: Yeah

author: A
sentence: Yeah definitely, and they're doing it based on what's trending

author: Q
sentence: Yeah, exactly

author: A
sentence: No-no, agree

author: A
sentence: And the good startups are moving very quickly to get into the market and then are able to scale their products quickly

author: A
sentence: The challenge is, for a startup - and this is one of the things that we push very hard on when I'm  - I also mentor at Stone & Chalk - so when we're talking to startups there as a mentor, it's, 'How can you simplify your message about your product? Because if you can simplify, you can get it to market faster

author: A
sentence: ' If it's contracts and you're adding more complexity, you're probably not going to get to market fast enough, so get it simpler, get the message clearer and even get your product simpler, because you're trying to do too much

author: A
sentence: If you are able to do that, then you can get to market, then you can scale, then you can actually take advantage of opportunities in the marketplace kind of thing

author: A
sentence: At the Director level, I struggle to find people who would have the full knowledge of all of that

author: A
sentence: Like, I don't understand company structures and corporate structures, I'm not a lawyer, and I would never sit in a Board room going, 'Yep, I can get across that'

author: A
sentence: I would either say, 'Do I need to know externally that this is good or not?' Therefore I'll go and get some external help, or if we've got somebody on the Board that we designate to be that person to actually inform the rest of the Board of what's going on

author: Q
sentence: So using external expertise as needed, so it's seeing the Board as really being able to pull in resources as needed, but knowing when it needs to do so is the duty of the Board, I guess

author: A
sentence: Yeah, yeah

author: A
sentence: Absolutely

author: A
sentence: I guess it's probably a little bit uncommon, but back 20 years or so ago, Boards really considered the information that management provided to them, and then made decisions based on their long-term history, business history

author: A
sentence: Nowadays, you can't do it that way, you've got to also have an external view, you've got to understand what else is going on

author: A
sentence: Management may have missed something, they may have missed a trend or something, so how do you actually keep on top of that? It's not just my gray hair and experience that's going to get me there, things have changed in the last 12 months that if I relied on what I knew last year, it wouldn’t be relevant today

author: Q
sentence: Okay, and social media is an important part of that external view?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, absolutely

author: Q
sentence: That's great

author: Q
sentence: As your role as a chair is really helpful too, because people have been saying, 'Oh, that's the Chair, the Chair does that' so it'd be good if we can drill down there

author: Q
sentence: Great, so now we'll move to Board functioning

author: Q
sentence: We want to understand how diversity influences Board functioning, so this is probably a drill down and an illustration of how you use that tool you talked about to make decisions

author: A
sentence: Yeah, well I guess it is, it's more a conscious, 'are we considering the various aspects of it?' People will be naturally biased to a particular side effect, you know, somebody might be very risk adverse all the time; somebody might be very worried about the people aspects, or the people considerations; somebody might be worried about strategy or future or those sorts of things

author: A
sentence: Typically most business people have been taught to be outcome-oriented, so they're driven to 'What's the result? How will we get an answer? Will we make any money?' those sorts of things, and that tends to be the dominating factor in any decision

author: A
sentence: So to deliberately remove that from the room and say, 'Right, we're not talking about outcomes or results

author: A
sentence: We're talking about the risks

author: A
sentence: Let's go around the table and discuss the risks that we might see associated with this decision

author: A
sentence: ' That kind of works in enterprise

author: A
sentence: Now in the not-for-profit world, your results or outcomes are not necessarily financially oriented, they're more about your society outcomes or things like that

author: A
sentence: And as a result, it's been easier to adopt it because sometimes it's not easy to see those outcomes or potential results, so if we start looking at it through the lenses of 'What risks do we have and could it meet here; what would our community think; what would our people think?' As we go around the table and talk about those different aspects, we quite often crystallise what the outcome is, so in a not-for-profit world, it's probably easier because you don't have that same P&L, shareholder value, results focus

author: A
sentence: But there is equally, a need to have an outcome that's solid and good and makes sense, and all that good stuff

author: A
sentence: I haven't seen it happen in the public company I'm in, but by nature, we tend to have taken on different roles as Board members, and the Chair is pretty good in making sure that everybody is heard, so if somebody hasn't said something, they're actually called to say, 'So what's your view?' and given, like I said, the roles that we've sort of taken, you tend to adopt the role that is yours, and that gives a fairly good, diverse view on the decisions that are being made

author: Q
sentence: So how do you know what your role is in the Board? Are you brought on for that, or

author: A
sentence: That's a good question, and I don't think it's been formally put in place, we haven't like you would in management team, we haven't got a CSO, we haven't got a CRO, CHRO or whatever, but it's probably just been something that people have naturally done

author: A
sentence: Now I was recruited onto the Board to bring skills in destruction and the impact of destruction and innovation on business and to make sure the Board had that view, so I probably am the one who has been given that specific role

author: A
sentence: But the Chair, I think, has probably chosen the Board members fairly carefully

author: A
sentence: One is a strong operational person who really understands how to make the business model work; another one is a strong financial person, investment banking background; and then another one is a strong legal background, so I think there's probably been - without it being public or stated - a fairly deliberate choosing of the Board members to make sure of that level of diversity, without it necessarily being spelt out, is actually there

author: Q
sentence: Okay, so the Directors backgrounds are really - that's where you get the idea of the role?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, that's probably true

author: Q
sentence: [pause] Is there any example of where diversity has contributed to conflict, like because you've defined it as - yeah

author: A
sentence: [pause] I haven't seen much conflict in my Board

author: A
sentence: I probably - [pause] yeah, I probably haven't had an experience where a Board's dysfunctional or anything like that

author: A
sentence: I've obviously heard of those stories, but I haven't been party to them

author: A
sentence: [laughs] Yeah, okay

author: Q
sentence: Has there been any - like you introduced a new tool, for example, on the not-for-profit Board, was there any resistance, or was everyone really flexible, happy to adopt?

author: A
sentence: Yeah-no, everyone was fairly - there was no pushback or, 'No, we're not going to it', or 'Why are we doing this?' We used to actually make a decision, so I think the way I probably did it made it easy, because we used it to make a decision that wasn't obvious at the time, and by using the tool, we were able to get a really good decision, so everyone went, 'Okay cool, that's good

author: A
sentence: What we were trying to work out is whether or not - so our not-for-profit, as a very quick background, is a charity that looks at building resilience into children, and so therefore we're actually targeting average Australia, 85% population, so 15-odd million people in families and children, to help eliminate mental health issues and perhaps drugs and other issues as children grow into teenagers and then adults

author: A
sentence: Now to get to those people, we're not talking about 15% that are disadvantaged, we're talking about mainstream Australia, so we were trying to figure out how do we do that and our vision or model was to scale by having trainers and teaching people how do it

author: A
sentence: And obviously getting to 15million people, we're going to have a very big organisation, so how could we adopt technology and the digital world to be able to make that come alive? Initially that was yeah, we can say that, but what does that really look like, and it was hard to get that picture, so we used a whole bunch of this tool, I guess, or this way of thinking, to drive out all the aspects of it, to be able to then go, 'Okay right, we can see how we can do this

author: A
sentence: ' And in doing so, we created a story and then the management team have now been chugging away, delivering on that story for the last, probably year and a half

author: Q
sentence: And the story was about how the service would work in the community?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, and therefore how would you get the results? If we wanted to get to 85% of the population, how would we do it?

author: Q
sentence: So the causal story, yeah

author: A
sentence: Yeah

author: A
sentence: And then it's kind of well, how do you make that more tangible by thinking about it differently and taking each person in the room - and if you just sat there and say, 'Well, give me an answer', no one could give you an answer

author: A
sentence: It's, 'Well okay, let's think about now what the community would want us to do; what would the government want us to do; what would other elements of society; what are the risks associated with it; how would our team have to evolve and what would that mean for our people' et cetera

author: A
sentence: As you have all of those discussions independently, you actually progress to a much clearer understanding of what the outcome could be

author: Q
sentence: Excellent, so this is like creative problem-solving?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, it probably is actually, in some form

author: Q
sentence: Diversity has contributed to creative and innovative ways of problem-solving, or opportunity creation, whatever

author: Q
sentence: I'll pick on you

author: A
sentence: Yep-yep, that's true

author: A
sentence: And you know, in a general sense, applying that in a management consulting space, you do that naturally, so this is just applying that at a Board level

author: Q
sentence: Yeah, because as you're saying, at a strategic level, this works brilliantly

author: A
sentence: Yeah

author: Q
sentence: And the old way actually, doesn't work so well, is what you were saying?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, that's true

author: A
sentence: The old way is a Board full of A-Type personalities and then over the last 10 years or so, you can swap out the males and make them females, but they're still A-Type personalities

author: A
sentence: This is kind of okay, let's recognise that diversity of thinking is what we're trying to get, and yes, you can get that by different gender, different age and different religion or whatever, but there's also you probably have to manage getting the diversity of thinking working

author: Q
sentence: Okay, so I can see that with recruitment then, when you're identifying potential new Board members, how would you go about this, to build your team that is capable of exercising such diverse thinking?

author: A
sentence: So we're actually doing that on this not-for-profit at the moment

author: A
sentence: We have a Board vacancy, or our Board has space for another person

author: A
sentence: We haven't had anybody leave or anything like that, it's just we think there's another role needed now

author: A
sentence: So we've used this to say what type of person do we need? Where are we not often enough, thinking about something that we should be, and where we're missing is the - let's call them 'investors' - but the people who may fund what we're doing

author: A
sentence: We're more worried about how we're operating and how we're bringing the service to the community, we haven't got enough people - we're not often enough naturally going to, 'But what would our funders think?' so we are deliberately trying to find somebody that would come from that background, or have that thinking in their mindset

author: Q
sentence: This is interesting

author: A
sentence: It's definitely - and that person would obviously then have that role on the Board

author: A
sentence: Now obviously they can contribute in any other way as well, but that's the primary reason to have that person on the Board

author: Q
sentence: Okay, so I'm seeing a benefit of - I'm calling it a 'tool' which I don’t know, however you want to talk about it, the different way -

author: Q
sentence: Thank you very much, 35D, for agreeing to be interviewed

author: Q
sentence: You’re probably aware that we’re exploring the diversity of boards, and we’re looking at Australian boards

author: Q
sentence: We’re seeking the understandings of people in Australia who are actually on boards, or from organisations that influence Australian boards

author: Q
sentence: So it’s ground-up understanding

author: Q
sentence: I’m interviewing you because you’re on at least one board

author: A
sentence: I was brought on a few years ago, two or three years ago and so when I left I was still the only female

author: A
sentence: While it’s listed it’s not a large company but I think it’s probably closer to the norm

author: A
sentence: I know some of the more prominent public companies will have more diversity because they’re more under the spotlight to have the diversity but I think that there are a lot of commercial boards still that really don’t have much in the way of diversity

author: A
sentence: That’s right

author: Q
sentence: Diversity, what does that mean to you, the word diversity?

author: A
sentence: On boards?

author: Q
sentence: Yes

author: A
sentence: Gender you’ve mentioned

author: A
sentence: Look, it is more than gender of course but we’ve got to be careful at some – I think you can get into tokenism at some point

author: A
sentence: My personal view is things like people being gay and all that sort of thing, I think that’s happening naturally, personally

author: A
sentence: It’s quite interesting

author: A
sentence: In Canberra, the number of gay advisers, it’s quite strong

author: A
sentence: I think the idea that someone is gay has become quite acceptable

author: A
sentence: I don’t see it as being – I’m sure there are times where they feel they may not be treated the right way, but I suspect that’s the same as what they find outside

author: A
sentence: This is just my view, and I’m sure they’ll bring different perspectives

author: A
sentence: Obviously, race is another one, but again, a lot of those issues I think are based on the fact that you haven’t – you probably have to apply some of the same things

author: A
sentence: I think gender has to be done first personally

author: A
sentence: I think gender has to be done first, and I think some of the literature started with gender but then got into race and sex and gender or whatever it is

author: A
sentence: I actually think you need to deal with gender first, as in as a priority because I think it’s quite hard to deal with

author: A
sentence: I believe that if that changes you’re going to have a mix that’s different and I do think a bigger mix of men and women will – you’ve got the biggest group of others in there and I believe that will start changing how they look at embracing others

author: A
sentence: I think they’re separate issues

author: A
sentence: How do we get more indigenous and others on boards? At the end of the day, they’re not getting educated yet

author: A
sentence: We’re really not getting enough through the system

author: Q
sentence: It’s the pipeline issue

author: A
sentence: It’s the pipeline issue

author: A
sentence: We’ve got women, more than 50 are going through uni so if we’re focusing on boards we’re at a position there is no reason you shouldn’t have 50/50 on boards

author: A
sentence: We’re not getting 50/50 in some of the other areas yet and it’s hard to assess it any way and the problems are different but I do think once you get – if you really did make that massive change and had 50/50 or at least the women, I think some of the other issues will start moving away

author: Q
sentence: Going back to an earlier point you made that if we focus on gender so we have women, equal number of women, if women who get on to boards are the ones who have unconsciously adopted the male point of view, they’ve done accounting and commercial law, very masculine disciplines, rational, competitive –

author: A
sentence: They are the ones that are sticking around and that’s why I have a problem with it, doing it the way we are because I chose very early on I didn’t want to be – I was offered a partnership for a law firm

author: A
sentence: I didn’t want to be a CEO

author: A
sentence: I looked at their lives and said I didn’t want to do it

author: A
sentence: A lot of women are like me and just say, “I don’t want to do it

author: A
sentence: ” The ones who do want to do it of course had been through the same and they’ve been through the pathway and they do become like men so we’re not changing the balance much and sometimes it works

author: Q
sentence: If you were the only female how many people on the board?

author: Q
sentence: There isn’t diversity then

author: A
sentence: No, so it isn’t diversity

author: A
sentence: Even my mum says, “Come on, you’re a white female 35D

author: A
sentence: What about all the Muslims and things?”

author: Q
sentence: Exactly

author: A
sentence: That’s why I think we have to change it quite radically for it to actually change

author: Q
sentence: What are we changing? Are we changing boards or society or –

author: A
sentence: You’re changing society

author: Q
sentence: The pipeline is society

author: A
sentence: I suspect it would be a bit tokenistic initially in the sense that people would be – like [Stuart]’s been, he visited Deloitte and they really did have an aggressive policy of promoting women over men

author: A
sentence: It makes the men very angry and it’s partly I don’t think they’re educating them well enough

author: A
sentence: They don’t realise that they’re just feeling what other people have felt

author: A
sentence: Morrison said, “We want to get equality but let’s not have anyone suffer

author: A
sentence: No one can miss out

author: A
sentence: This is not equal some game or something,” he said

author: A
sentence: I’m going, “No, it is actually

author: A
sentence: ” I don’t see how it could happen but I do think you do need to change society

author: A
sentence: I think we’ve got more chance of it happening in politics than we have in business even though I still think that’s quite tough

author: A
sentence: If 35D said okay we’re going to go 50/50, you’d actually start seeing a lot more movement and that’s where it really needs to happen because they can change it

author: A
sentence: It’s actually a bit hard

author: A
sentence: It is a bit rough to tell a company you have to have 50/50 because at the end of the day it is their business and it is their shareholder’s money

author: A
sentence: They answer to the shareholders

author: A
sentence: We’ve designed them not for social purpose

author: A
sentence: We’ve designed them to make money

author: Q
sentence: Commercial

author: Q
sentence: Do you see that as an either/or? Some people see corporate social responsibility as a better sustainable commercial enterprise

author: A
sentence: Six or seven

author: A
sentence: Yes but you pay lip service to that too

author: Q
sentence: This is what I was wondering

author: A
sentence: You pay lip service to that too but that’s a whole cultural thing

author: A
sentence: It’s about how we bring up our kids

author: Q
sentence: What do you mean?

author: A
sentence: These boys that become CEO, they’re there to win in the football team

author: A
sentence: They’re to win this and they’re to win that and they’re really not there

author: A
sentence: Yes, they might go and send something to an auction to make some money for a charity

author: A
sentence: That’s tokenistic or there to help them

author: A
sentence: I don’t think we’ve gone beyond that yet

author: Q
sentence: This is social change and targeting men in that competitiveness

author: A
sentence: Though I do think women, if you really did get 50/50 but not the way we’re going because I agree with you, it doesn’t look like diversity if it’s just the ones that get through the current system

author: A
sentence: If you do get 50/50 and you really do get a mix of women, not just me then you will – because I am seen as quite, I’m quite commercial

author: A
sentence: I’m definitely not used often

author: A
sentence: There’s a big spectrum of women on one of the other sides with me

author: A
sentence: But if you really did that, if you could imagine a world like that then I think we would change a lot of things

author: A
sentence: I think the companies would change because you’re going to answer, everyone’s going to answer for something broader

author: Q
sentence: Do you think the younger generation – I’ve interviewed some younger people in their early 40s, probably their early 40s and they were in a start-up context but they were very passionate about social, the organisation as being part of a bigger system, social, economic, ethical –

author: A
sentence: I think that’s right

author: Q
sentence: They were really trained to develop products and services that would work with that system of course and value-add and environmental footprint, social footprint

author: Q
sentence: They were using this, I mean you say token that –

author: Q
sentence: So you’re under the 30% target

author: A
sentence: No, I don’t say that’s token

author: A
sentence: I think there a lot of people – in my era that really wasn’t a viable thing but I do think there are a lot of people trying to get both ways, to get a business to make money but also to do it in a social responsible way

author: A
sentence: I’m not sure we’ve worked out how to do that very well, as in some of the, what’s environmentally friendly and that’s usually a lot of, a bit cynical

author: Q
sentence: I know

author: A
sentence: But that aside, I do think as I was saying, the younger generation does have a – we’ve got five kids

author: A
sentence: They’re all early 20s and there’s a mix

author: A
sentence: I think the way I would say it is they’re more socially aware

author: A
sentence: There are some who started business but their number one aim is to start a business but they know that to attract their market and their positioning is one that’s environmental and it does make them feel better because they’ve been brought up with a very leftist view to how they sell themselves, that is a bit cynical but it’s a bit true

author: A
sentence: It is true

author: A
sentence: There’s more hope with some of the younger generations than there was with mine because we didn’t even get taught anything about social responsibility

author: A
sentence: I do think it will happen like Hearn over in New Zealand for example

author: Q
sentence: Amazing

author: A
sentence: Those sorts of role models will have an effect

author: A
sentence: It was evidenced by Tanya

author: A
sentence: We’re miles from that

author: A
sentence: I don’t blame her at all but it’s –

author: Q
sentence: That’s sad

author: A
sentence: I know her quite well

author: A
sentence: She’s not actually that good

author: A
sentence: The one we should have got was Nicola Roxon

author: A
sentence: She was brilliant, but see, she was like me

author: A
sentence: She looked at Rudd for five minutes and goes, “I’m getting out of here

author: A
sentence: ” She’d get me a bit longer than that

author: A
sentence: The good ones leave

author: A
sentence: Someone like Hearn over in New Zealand, a great role model

author: A
sentence: If people step up – some of the younger women are quite good too

author: A
sentence: Some of them, they are amazing because they didn’t – I’ve got one daughter

author: A
sentence: We call her post-modern girl

author: A
sentence: They don’t have the same inhibitions

author: A
sentence: They don’t walk around with that same sense of, I’ve got to better looking, a bit this and a bit that

author: A
sentence: They’re just much more self-assured

author: Q
sentence: It’s lovely, isn’t it?

author: A
sentence: I think they’re all fabulous signs and that’s why it needs to happen

author: Q
sentence: Even with that ray of hope, I wonder if in a global – you’ve worked in a global context

author: Q
sentence: The social footprint is not just Australia, not just local

author: Q
sentence: It’s a bit ill-defined and it could be somewhere you don’t particularly care about

author: Q
sentence: The globalisation problem for larger companies do you think that’s perhaps an inhibitor to the social responsibility idea, your 20 year old?

author: A
sentence: They were under pressure for that

author: A
sentence: Globalisation obviously worked against any what I call unique solutions I think

author: A
sentence: If Australia wanted to do something different it would be quite hard because of its global pressures

author: A
sentence: On social responsibility, we’re still very strongly led by the US and that’s a problem at the moment

author: A
sentence: The bigger issue for boards is in fact what my husband lectures on, and that’s disruption

author: A
sentence: It’s the whole – like your [unclear] 00:42:40 and all the rest of it

author: A
sentence: They’re crucifying local businesses

author: A
sentence: Now we’ve got Amazon, and they’re going to make it really tough, and so we won’t actually have that many boards, because the businesses won’t survive

author: A
sentence: I think it is the movement to global businesses that is actually a real thing

author: A
sentence: I think a lot of other countries are better than we are

author: A
sentence: I do think we are a bit of an outlook in terms of our culture

author: A
sentence: I think our culture if we – you know how I always talk about boards not working together but as a country we are

author: A
sentence: It’s actually quite a small country

author: A
sentence: It’s very easy to – the world of politics is small, the world of business is small

author: A
sentence: If you’re in one or the other you know everyone

author: A
sentence: That doesn’t happen in the US or in Europe

author: Q
sentence: Because they’re big

author: A
sentence: They’re much bigger

author: A
sentence: There’s a lot more competition

author: A
sentence: It’s tougher

author: A
sentence: In Australia, you will get a job as a CEO if you’ve been in the Fin Review, even if those things you’d been in the Fin Review are bad because you look at some of the CEOs and once they get the job they haven’t succeeded

author: A
sentence: They’ve just been in the Fin Review a few times, a bit more than a few times but they’ve got a name and they’ll blame something else

author: A
sentence: I’m not sure whether that’s a context of globalisation but I do – in some ways I think globalisation will force boards to pick up their game

author: Q
sentence: But it shows that Australian boards are influenced by not just our organisations and institutions that we’ve been interviewing but the broader –

author: A
sentence: But as boards I think we actually possibly are too isolated as boards, not as businesses, as boards

author: Q
sentence: Does that affect diversity on boards?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, I think the capability of our boards is quite low

author: A
sentence: I think if we were in America or Europe, the competition for the board positions and the expectation of board behaviour and things would be a lot higher

author: Q
sentence: Really? So we have lower expectations?

author: A
sentence: I think so

author: A
sentence: I think the standards in our boards are pretty low

author: Q
sentence: Do you think those targets are effective?

author: Q
sentence: Is that a cultural thing or is it legal framework?

author: A
sentence: It’s a small world

author: A
sentence: It’s a small group

author: A
sentence: You’re not there by merit

author: A
sentence: You’re there by whether you know someone

author: A
sentence: There are a lot of people with a lot of merit who could do a lot but they’re not the ones in there because you don’t want anyone to ruffle the boat, rock the boat too much

author: Q
sentence: It’s the culture of not valuing conflict and robust debate

author: A
sentence: I think we’re still isolated

author: A
sentence: I think we’re pretty backward in the development of board skills

author: Q
sentence: Did you do some board development work over in the States or something like that to –

author: A
sentence: No, but I’ve worked – probably just being exposed to companies and the executives

author: A
sentence: I’ve been to a lot of conferences and things and I suppose what I see

author: A
sentence: Because I haven’t sat around their board table, it could well be just good PR

author: Q
sentence: True

author: Q
sentence: You haven’t been one of their members

author: A
sentence: I’m also probably influenced by the fact that it is a bit of a club here

author: A
sentence: Our political club and our company club, it’s all a bit of a club

author: Q
sentence: We’re so small

author: Q
sentence: That’s an interesting structural fact

author: Q
sentence: We want to know how diversity influences board functioning

author: Q
sentence: Can we talk about bullying conflict, how that process is managed? Problem solving, how decision making might be facilitated by diversity?

author: A
sentence: How could it be managed? First of all I think you need, chairs probably do need a bit of training

author: A
sentence: That might be the way to start because ultimately it’s the job for the chair to pick up culture

author: A
sentence: At the moment a chair sees his role as keeping sweet with the CEO and the board as higher

author: A
sentence: They don’t necessarily see it because they’re – I said something to CEO and he said, “Look, you’re strong enough

author: A
sentence: You can deal with it

author: A
sentence: ” That was the answer and because you’re tough you can deal with it, not, I shouldn’t have to deal with it

author: A
sentence: If I were a shrinking violet and this guy behaved the way he did, someone may have reason to be more –

author: A
sentence: I think they are effective in a sense that at least it caused them to think about it

author: A
sentence: It doesn’t ever get reported who I was with or anything? It’s actually de-identified?

author: Q
sentence: To rescue you

author: A
sentence: To more rescue me, right? But if you don’t need rescuing you fight your own fight

author: A
sentence: It’s just the way they position you

author: A
sentence: “You don’t understand x or you don’t understand y or whatever

author: A
sentence: ” I’m going, “I do actually

author: A
sentence: It’s just I have a different view

author: A
sentence: ” But it gets positioned in a particular way and I think you need the chairs, they need to see this as their responsibility

author: A
sentence: Not many board members are actually going to complain about bullying

author: A
sentence: I’ve never complained about any bullying

author: A
sentence: I live with it all the time

author: A
sentence: But if say for example it was a clear responsibility of the chair to deal with it that might change it

author: A
sentence: Because if some women started being a little bit, I might not do anything about it but then other women will and if it was seen as – if the chair lets it go and it’s their responsibility to deal with it, then maybe something might start happening

author: A
sentence: But then I recognise, you’ve picked it up pretty quickly

author: A
sentence: They’ll come to your rescue

author: A
sentence: That’s exactly right

author: A
sentence: It’s demeaning

author: A
sentence: A lot of women play that role quite effectively and I don’t mean it in a negative way

author: A
sentence: I’m just saying that’s the way it works and men love it

author: A
sentence: They feel really good about it

author: Q
sentence: But then it’s a game

author: A
sentence: I think the only thing you can do is bring it back to the chair

author: Q
sentence: That idea then the chair, we can cultivate the chair role that might be something

author: A
sentence: The other thing we did was when I – my first board meeting at this company we got letters from an employee claiming sexual harassment or something

author: A
sentence: It was against another employee and then she wrote a few other people

author: A
sentence: It was my first meeting and I said, “Look, this is actually quite serious

author: A
sentence: We can’t just let it go

author: A
sentence: ” This lady was the head of their legal department too and I said, “We need someone independent to come in and to nip this one in the bud

author: A
sentence: ” She’s not an easy person to deal with, because I did suspect the woman itself is a big part of the problem, but I could also see there were a lot of problems already in the culture, that I’m going, ‘Hmm, I think she’s going to have a pay day

author: A
sentence: It’ll become a mess very quickly

author: A
sentence: So we got an independent guy in

author: A
sentence: He was brilliant, and so there are people out there who – because I’ve put up with so much for so long, because I had a patriarchal father, you gave as good as you got and you worked out how to play that game

author: A
sentence: But having access, and more ready access – this guy – [inaudible] 00:50:40 didn’t cost that much in the context of what boards spend

author: A
sentence: He came in

author: A
sentence: He had a very proper process

author: A
sentence: He interviewed the relevant people

author: A
sentence: He documented the thing

author: A
sentence: He came back to the board

author: A
sentence: He spoke with them

author: A
sentence: He gave insight into – he used organisational language

author: A
sentence: He could explain it in a way normal people can’t explain it

author: A
sentence: He could see exactly what was going on and we need more of that rather than go straight to the courts

author: A
sentence: Look so and so should pick up bullying

author: A
sentence: That’s not going to be very helpful

author: A
sentence: But this idea that maybe it’s seen as more – AICD is trying to do this but the idea that it is seen as good practice to get people to come in and assess these things and the AICD is promoting some of that stuff

author: A
sentence: Not necessarily focused on bullying, more focusing on the broader role of the board which is not necessarily, it’s not a bad thing

author: A
sentence: But I do think having external influences, maybe boards have to get reports done on their own behaviour, that sort of thing

author: Q
sentence: On their functioning

author: Q
sentence: It’s de-identified

author: A
sentence: Yeah, because I think it will come out differently

author: Q
sentence: It’s like 360 but with an observation and observer as well

author: Q
sentence: That’s good

author: Q
sentence: Have you seen conflict because of diversity, how it was managed, how it was disruptive?

author: A
sentence: I’ve always been the token female

author: A
sentence: I’m a token female

author: A
sentence: I wasn’t a token female in a lot of boards so I generally didn’t have conflict and even this one, I didn’t let it get to conflict

author: A
sentence: I just decided I didn’t like that behaviour

author: A
sentence: I never stood up to him

author: A
sentence: We talked about the issues at the board

author: A
sentence: I never ever called him out on anything

author: A
sentence: I never did, and I never would

author: A
sentence: It’s just not my personality, but I could have

author: A
sentence: If I was a different person, I would have

author: A
sentence: Because he was [appalling] 00:52:43

author: Q
sentence: What about the problem-solving, the decisions made? Your voice then was not heard

author: A
sentence: No

author: A
sentence: This particular guy, what was it? Then we started interviewing – he said, we had an employee that came in a senior manager and she really left us an alert

author: A
sentence: We just got that she got cancer and she’d had it before

author: A
sentence: It was a reoccurrence

author: A
sentence: This guy was so angry because of course the sales and everything went down

author: A
sentence: She’s head of sales

author: A
sentence: “Now I’m interviewing them all and I’m asking them whether they’re sick and whether they’re this and whether they’re that

author: A
sentence: ” I said, “I’m not sure you can do that

author: A
sentence: Maybe you’re not allowed to ask those questions

author: A
sentence: ” “I am

author: A
sentence: It’s my right” then that’s when this other guy backed me

author: A
sentence: I don’t know what happened at the end of that

author: A
sentence: I suspect he still asked the questions and we are still potentially liable

author: A
sentence: So it’s like, here a conflict

author: A
sentence: I’ll put it forward but I –

author: Q
sentence: It’s passive resistance

author: Q
sentence: You’re just –

author: A
sentence: I table it and if you’ve got a good, we actually had a good, one of the good things is to have an independent company secretary because if you – he didn’t record everything

author: A
sentence: He was quite a good professional company secretary and that helped a bit

author: Q
sentence: Because it’s documented

author: A
sentence: First of all he documented but also he wasn’t totally silent

author: A
sentence: Some of these things, I think might be a bit right

author: A
sentence: Because our chair was so weak it didn’t quite work, but it was a real help to have an independent [unclear] 00:54:31

author: A
sentence: First of all, you’re talking about a personality type that’s possibly closer – and I know I’m being stereotypical myself, but maybe more that he’s not the entrepreneurial stereotype of some of the males

author: A
sentence: I’ll put it that way

author: A
sentence: It was a guy

author: A
sentence: He’s bringing in a diverse view because he’s a different style of individual, and that was actually very helpful

author: Q
sentence: That’s different approaches to decision making, to thinking

author: Q
sentence: It’s cognitive diversity

author: Q
sentence: That’s seen as a very interesting way of thinking about diversity

author: A
sentence: The problem is most boards actually don’t realise they have a problem and they don’t know how to fix it because the main reason I left was culture

author: A
sentence: One of the guys was a bully, a total bully and the chairman of course doesn’t pick it up

author: A
sentence: They just don’t realise how patriarchal they’ve been

author: A
sentence: They just don’t realise it and so I do think the targets are important because you get them to look at it

author: A
sentence: There’s no easy answer but it’s very hard, particularly – see, in larger organisations, if I say [Stuart] 00:04:12 was at Deloitte, they’re having it drummed into them

author: A
sentence: The guys are having it drummed into them all the time, diversity, diversity, whether they like it or not

author: A
sentence: Gradually they sort of work it out, most of them but in organisations where they just don’t have that infrastructure and they don’t have that commitment coming from the top, I think it’s very hard for those cultures to change

author: A
sentence: It’s just putting things in a way that are – you’ve got to work with what you’ve got

author: A
sentence: That worked for us

author: Q
sentence: That was a process person whereas you are all outcomes

author: A
sentence: It’s really different and because he was independent and we employed him as an independent person, he brought a sub-skill

author: A
sentence: He could talk about how other boards did things and it was good

author: Q
sentence: Another thing because I’m aware of the time, how were new board members recruited?

author: A
sentence: I was the only one recruited at that time in that particular company

author: A
sentence: Poorly

author: Q
sentence: I love one-word answers

author: Q
sentence: It’s someone who knew someone

author: A
sentence: I was the one who asked for the financials

author: A
sentence: I was the one who asked to go and speak to them about them, to understand a few things

author: A
sentence: They didn’t even know what insurance they had so I had to go and have a look at it and told them, “Actually it’s not very good

author: A
sentence: You better fix this

author: Q
sentence: You were selected because someone knew you?

author: A
sentence: I knew the CEO

author: A
sentence: I was big for them in a few ways

author: A
sentence: I was a female

author: A
sentence: I was on the advisory board for Digital Health and worked in this sector for a long time

author: A
sentence: I knew their customer base so I was someone they would always want

author: Q
sentence: You were an attractive card for them and you wouldn’t know how they typically recruit because –

author: Q
sentence: I’ll put this to you because I’m 27 interviews in

author: Q
sentence: This idea of inclusivity, of being able to include people, inclusion so it’s a cultural thing and a role thing as well that’s been coming up, how important is that to having a diverse board? I think it’s interesting that you said you left because of culture and a bully and patriarchy

author: Q
sentence: Is that a lack of inclusion, a lack of capacity?

author: A
sentence: They didn’t bring people in very often

author: Q
sentence: Do you think that not having a turnover is a problem?

author: A
sentence: Yeah, I do because even when I was leaving, one of the other guys who’s been there, the nice guy actually, he was putting his hand up again and the others have been there for donkeys

author: A
sentence: I think there should a forced turnover

author: A
sentence: That would actually a bit – in fact I think it would help the diversity because you’d get the question each time

author: Q
sentence: Exactly

author: Q
sentence: Did anyone external to the board influence the criteria for selecting members, like recruitment people?

author: A
sentence: A lot of companies I had spoken to when I’ve been looking at board positions they definitely use external

author: A
sentence: They’re not necessarily the norm

author: Q
sentence: Even in that commercial?

author: A
sentence: In the commercial I think for me – I don’t think they believe they needed a new director

author: A
sentence: I think they wanted a female because they need to get that done and they thought I would bring stuff and the guy knew me so I don’t think it was because they were looking for another person

author: A
sentence: But I do think it is more common for people to use a professional head hunter or recruitment companies and they would provide advice without trying to lose their job

author: Q
sentence: I’m going to go straight to the last question

author: A
sentence: Sorry

author: Q
sentence: No

author: Q
sentence: You’ve been brilliant

author: Q
sentence: Don’t worry

author: Q
sentence: Looking 10 years into the future, how would you like to see the diversity in Australian boards?

author: A
sentence: I’ve just resigned from a listed company, x, and then the others are more advisory, so I’m on an advisory board to a University

author: A
sentence: I’m also on an advisory board to, I think it’s called an advisory

author: A
sentence: It must be an advisory board to a government board regarding digital health

author: A
sentence: They don’t realise it

author: A
sentence: If you go out to dinner with them it’ll all be all about World War II

author: A
sentence: They just don’t realise

author: A
sentence: One guy was nice

author: A
sentence: He is a sweet guy

author: A
sentence: He’s a gentleman

author: A
sentence: There are men who know that role

author: A
sentence: He was very respectful and in fact was probably one of my bigger allies because he’s been on some other big boards so it’s probably – he’s a bit more open

author: A
sentence: He’s an ex-politician too so he was more aware

author: A
sentence: A lot of them really, particularly the entrepreneurial type, they’ve never been stopped

author: A
sentence: They go home to their wives

author: A
sentence: There is a particular role they play and no one’s pulled them up

author: A
sentence: They clearly haven’t got strong daughters otherwise they would have pulled them up

author: A
sentence: Of course I’d like to see it changed but I truly don’t want – as you say, I don’t necessarily just want to see women capable of playing on the AFL football field

author: A
sentence: I’m actually quite concerned about that because a lot of my ask was about what the kids – having four daughters, what’s the world going to be like for them? It really concerns me that this idea of having a child as opposed to it just happened somewhere and we’re supposed to have everything equal so that’s important

author: A
sentence: I don’t have a sense of a – I don’t believe there is a design in their minds of what they’re looking for

author: A
sentence: They’re quite confused because they are starting to believe that having a child is something that will jeopardise their chances or if we do have a child that shouldn’t influence my chances of something

author: A
sentence: At the end of the day, I think children is a key part of being a female and having children and bringing them up well is a key part of our social responsibility

author: A
sentence: I do worry about that however there are quite a lot of – I don’t know how we’re going to make it work but there are quite a lot of good things happening too

author: A
sentence: Men are taking maternity leave but I think it comes back to, it’s all about what we want and everyone wants everything and they want what everyone else has got

author: A
sentence: So we want maternity leave, we want this and we want that but we’re not willing to give anything up because we think what we’ve got is precious

author: A
sentence: We’ll probably have some bigger problems to worry about though

author: A
sentence: Unfortunately, we tend to respond to big change

author: A
sentence: When things are shaken up a lot, we tend to respond

author: Q
sentence: I always wonder if that’s because we haven’t made the little changes

author: A
sentence: That’s exactly right

author: A
sentence: A lot of problems go away

author: A
sentence: It’s like individually, you get cancer

author: A
sentence: A lot of other problems go away, don’t they? We are like that as a nation, and I don’t know that we can do much about it

author: A
sentence: I think it’s part of our human makeup

author: A
sentence: There are some leading lights, which, if we got – my idea would be we’ve got some really good female leadership in Canberra, and in fact I was thinking before the last election, there were a few women starting to realise what it was like and unfortunately, they hadn’t stick together

author: A
sentence: There was a group of them and if they had stuck together – they were picked off

author: A
sentence: If they had stuck together and actually told a cohesive story you’d actually get a party up

author: A
sentence: Once someone says, “It’s okay

author: A
sentence: Yes, that’s a bit better” but boy, I’m not sure they’d get the numbers though

sentence: I even talked to my mother and she goes, “No, we should just be quiet and let things happen

sentence: Why are they going to worry about what these rich people are doing on boards? My mum used boards, we were having this debate and she used boards as an example of rich people or something

sentence: I had to help them with quite a few things that they were really struggling with because they didn’t see the problem

author: A
sentence: They had some bullying internally and things like that

author: A
sentence: I had to represent the board to help them with those things because they didn’t know which way to turn

author: A
sentence: I don’t think that’s where the change is going to come

author: A
sentence: This is about diversity and I think that is the angle

author: A
sentence: It’s not about my right to have what some other men

author: A
sentence: I actually don’t have a view that we should have equality for that reason

author: A
sentence: I don’t have a view that any of us have any rights at all

author: A
sentence: I have a view that it’s about what is better for us a country or as a society

author: A
sentence: I have a view we’re all related and we should look at ourselves as one big race

author: A
sentence: I think diversity is better for that and I think that’s the language that’s got to start coming out, rather than some of the other laws we’ve got coming out, about politician [unclear] 01:03:59 and things like that, the class wars, we’re going the opposite direction

author: A
sentence: But I do think there is –

sentence: They haven’t worked out how to do it because none of the people will agree to something but I do think Hearn, she’s a good role model

sentence: While some of the bigger boards do have more women on, they still really often – there are some exceptions

sentence: There are some strong women but across the board the numbers are skewed because so many women are given the more female-appropriate roles or there’s not more than 50%

author: A
sentence: You definitely don’t have – if it is something that would split on gender and a lot of things do because it’s how you would approach something and how much you can – in a board if you want to have a conversation often it’s you’ve got to tip toe around

author: A
sentence: You got a CEO putting something forward and you go, “How about we have a conversation about x?” You can only get that conversation really going if first of all, you’ve got enough people who say, “Yes, that’s a good idea” and secondly, then there’s enough people with an adept thinking along those lines to have that conversation

author: A
sentence: You need more than a few women to do that

sentence: I said at least this is what you do

sentence: I wanted to work out how far have we got on gender

author: A
sentence: I have a view that the Financial Review is the paper that reflects who’s moving the power around

author: A
sentence: I went through, and analysed the female-versus-male split

author: A
sentence: And I’ve got it, and it’s outrageous

author: A
sentence: The way women are presented is always next to a man, holding a man

author: A
sentence: They’re presented as others, you’d know what that means

author: A
sentence: Or women get used to speak for the CEO when it’s on a difficult issue, where you need more sympathy, or their advisers

author: A
sentence: There was very little – and it was during the election period, so you had quite election coverage as well, where you do have a stronger representation of women, not good enough

author: A
sentence: We have stronger than we do in business, and that came through

author: A
sentence: But if you looked carefully at the articles where the women were getting a lot of airplay, it was because they were talking about women

author: A
sentence: It’s about talking about the issue of gender and it was just startling

author: A
sentence: Even the journalists, I thought, if you look at the Fin Review of journalists, chief of staff male, is assistant, female

author: A
sentence: The next level, male, assistant –

author: Q
sentence: Female

author: Q
sentence: So there’s always a female underneath probably doing all the work

author: A
sentence: Like Tanya Plibersek

author: A
sentence: So my view is that unless we actually force a change I don’t think we’ll ever get to do it by the way

author: A
sentence: But theoretically, I think it will be very hard to get there without forcing a change which is sort of sad because we’ve actually got to make those places, places that women want to go

author: A
sentence: What we’re doing at the moment is you’re sort of like me

author: A
sentence: So you’ll be on a board and it’s not where you want to be

author: A
sentence: You know it could be done better

sentence: They had looked through a particularly lens and the culture is the one that’s being defined

author: A
sentence: I can go and play in their culture but we need to change it

author: A
sentence: For everything to do better we need the culture to change and the only way we can do that is in fact if you actually get the numbers a lot more equal

author: A
sentence: That’s why I actually think, I don’t think we have a choice

author: A
sentence: I think we’re going to have to go the slower way but I think I’ve actually come to a view that I support recruiting women over a man even if theoretically she may not be as good because often the criteria has already been established through some precedent

sentence: We keep everyone employed

author: A

sentence: Women culture and society

author: A

sentence: I don’t want to be the same

author: A
sentence: I suppose there is the anti-discrimination legislation, which obviously is supposed to protect – and protecting women’s jobs after maternity – I think the laws that allow women to work when they had children, which is going back to the ’60s, which then goes to having maternity leave and the rights when you come back

author: A
sentence: To be honest, I think it’s the maternity leave arrangements and the idea that a woman was entitled to keep her job and have a job when they had children, I think that’s probably the turning point

author: A
sentence: Because I retired from my full-time work last November and up until that time I was on a lot of boards but a lot of them are associated with government, et cetera

sentence: The main commercial one which is what I understood was one of the things you were looking for, was Xwhich is a listed company

author: Q
sentence: That really links to this feminism of the 70s

sentence: By the way, on feminism I would never have said I was a feminist when I was working

author: A
sentence: I wouldn’t have said it

author: A
sentence: I wasn’t even thinking about it because you only survive by not thinking that way

author: A
sentence: I’d never even thought about it

author: Q

sentence: I spoke to one of my male colleagues recently

sentence: I said, “I’ve decided I’m declaring I’m a feminist” and he says, “We’ve always known that

sentence: ” He’s open minded of course

author: A

author: A

author: A

author: A
sentence: She gave the example of the trams where for years they couldn’t get a female tram driver even though they were allowed because none of them would apply

author: A

author: A

author: A
sentence: They put out an ad

author: A

author: A

author: A

author: A

author: A
sentence: But I do think through that, I think that sort of education is very good but I don’t know that a lot of people avail themselves to it

sentence: A lot of people I’ve interviewed have – they didn’t say they did one where you – the intensive one

author: A
sentence: You’ve got the basic ones but then there is one where you actually become a board member and effectively they create a company and you have your other colleagues

author: A
sentence: You actually go through a live one week of living with it so it’s a whole year in one week

author: A
sentence: It is quite good in one week of recognising the benefits of other people’s styles

author: A
sentence: It was quite good, because you do – I’ve always worked in the corporate world

author: A
sentence: A corporate board wasn’t far off that, and I was company secretary for McEwans when I was 30, so I’d been involved with boards my whole life

author: A
sentence: But I had not been exposed to not-for-profits, not the sort of people I was coming across there

author: A
sentence: I was always more connected to business

author: A
sentence: I walked in, and I go, “Oh my god, really?” I shouldn’t say that

author: A
sentence: I was as bad as it looks

author: A
sentence: I really was

author: A
sentence: There wasn’t a commercial bone in most of them, and they were into all this airy-fairy stuff, and so I sounded exactly like the blokes

author: A
sentence: But after a week of it, you actually got to appreciate the benefit of having that diversity

author: Q
sentence: Of thinking?

author: A
sentence: Yeah

author: A
sentence: People I turn my nose up at, not really but you know, you did –

author: Q
sentence: You felt inside

author: A

author: A
sentence: They would be but when you put – to get them together

author: A
sentence: First of all, the one interesting thing is I rose to do the financials which I would never have done in a corporate board because I’m always pushed down

author: A
sentence: I’m an accountant

author: A
sentence: I still wouldn’t do it

author: A
sentence: The blokes they take that on and so I took that on because I was one of the more commercial-minded so I got an option to do something I wouldn’t do

author: A
sentence: But then I also got to see what some of the others could do and the way they looked at some issues, I wouldn’t have looked them that way and it was good

author: A
sentence: So I do think that sort of exposure and possibly, they don’t design it for that purpose really

author: A
sentence: I suppose that’s mixed purposes but that sort of thing is good, that idea of cross fertilisation

author: A
sentence: It’s not just about you learning the rules

author: A
sentence: It’s you getting that benefit of working with other people

sentence: The one I was on, I was on to become the female

author: A
sentence: They’ve got governance down because they have to but they haven’t got the strategic side so getting closer to what a board could be and how it could work, that was also very good

author: A
sentence: You really need to have a senior executive experience to get on a board

sentence: Yeah, because that’s where you learn strategy

author: Q

author: A
sentence: That particular week you did have that because what happened was it was very intense and unreasonably direct and so there was a point which I said, “We have 10 things we have to do

author: A
sentence: ” The board had to do 10 things in about 10 minutes and I just piped up and I said, “Look, there is no way we’re going to do that at this rate so I’m proposing, I’m going to take these four off with those three people because we know something about that and do that

author: A
sentence: You do the other things

author: A
sentence: ” Even within that week, it forced those who did gibber around a bit to work within constraints

author: A
sentence: So yes, I do think it tested in fact exactly that

author: Q
sentence: Maybe when we’re talking about board functioning, that kind of process would be really important for people, for boards

author: A
sentence: There is cross fertilisation in terms of some of the networks

author: A
sentence: People know everyone but they’re all too busy

author: A
sentence: They’re not really talking about how they operate on a board

author: A
sentence: They’re too important for that

author: A
sentence: But if there was some sort of, if there were some cross fertilisation sideways, so you have the AICD as one thing but at the moment it’s also a cultural thing

author: A
sentence: I represented the industries to government so my job was bringing industries together

author: A
sentence: My view was you are stronger as an industry than doing things separately and so I always had competitors in the room

author: A
sentence: There are clearly things you couldn’t do but there are a lot of things you can do

author: A
sentence: In fact our meetings, because they were cross fertilised, meant because they came to our meeting so I was pretty tough on them and then they would go back to their boards and that would improve their boards

author: A
sentence: That’s through industry association but I do think that if boards were seen as a more sideways collegiate group, if there was some sort of sense that boards cross fertilise sideways without the competitive issue because it comes from that corporate structure

author: A
sentence: It’s a legal entity and so legal entities are like us

author: A
sentence: The theory is it’s individual but we don’t as individuals try and do it all ourselves

author: A
sentence: We work in groups

author: A
sentence: Companies don’t and that’s partly because they’re so scared of A triple C, the trade practices

author: A
sentence: But there’s a lot you can do without worrying about that and it’s a bit like the difference between a board working as governance and a board working strategic

author: A
sentence: There are a lot of things they can do but they haven’t – no one’s really facilitated it but there is a lot of opportunity for boards to work sideways

author: Q
sentence: You mean sideways –

author: A
sentence: Cross collaborate and they have effectively AICD things and they’re more seen as, you’re not going to a school

author: A
sentence: There is no reason you couldn’t have something where current board members once a year were going off to do something

author: Q

author: A

author: A
sentence: One day someone will think about it but I do think you need that cross fertilisation across boards because we couldn’t do it as individuals

author: A
sentence: What companies are doing, they’re just sitting within the legal framework that they’ve been given and then the business framework of whatever they’re trying to do and who they’re competing with

author: A
sentence: Then they’re trying to do it alone and obviously they’re trying to cross fertilise within them

author: A

sentence: Some clients saw that as a positive and some saw it as quite a threat

author: A
sentence: That we were basically saying you either partner with us or we’ll do it without you or with somebody else

author: A
sentence: But Telstra took it pretty well, for example

author: A
sentence: That would be a good synopsis

author: Q
sentence: Beautiful

author: Q
sentence: We want to model, we want to develop a model

author: Q
sentence: This sounds pretty good

author: Q
sentence: Great

author: Q
sentence: Okay

author: Q
sentence: Now we’re going to look at board functioning

author: Q
sentence: And you’ve been chair, plus director, so you’ve got multiple different experiences

author: Q
sentence: So, how does diversity influence board functioning?

author: A
sentence: I was just thinking about those examples, like I said earlier, where you –different personality types

author: A
sentence: If you had too many introverts, you can have a board that the chair virtually leads it through and the agenda in no time, because people are just nodding and saying, okay, that sounds good, yes, I approve, I agree

author: A
sentence: On the other hand, if you have a bunch of ego maniacs, extroverts, who are wanting to be heard on every issue, then that can sort of shout others out or lead to a, where are we going with this

author: A
sentence: Everybody wants to have a say, even if they’re actually building on other people’s points, et cetera

author: A
sentence: So, that’s really, it’s really important, I think, to get that culture in the group developed where people, even if they don’t start of right, they gradually come to sort of understand that we’re going to be a group that listens to each other

author: A
sentence: That builds off each other’s points rather than just ignores them and makes their own

author: A
sentence: I had a little bit of experience yesterday where I felt one director was really dominating the day

author: A
sentence: And it was almost like too much caffeine

author: A
sentence: Just did strike me that one of the other directors said very little, possibly as a result

author: A
sentence: Just sort of okay, you keep going

author: A
sentence: It struck me on a relatively small board, that wasn’t ideal

author: A
sentence: We got what we needed to get done

author: A
sentence: But it wasn’t the perfect day

author: A
sentence: Sometimes you come out of a board meeting and think, gee that went well, I really did a good job there today

author: A
sentence: And it’s not really you as the chair, it’s just things worked

author: A
sentence: Other times you walk out and you think that was sort of a little odd, but we sort of got there

author: A
sentence: And other times you think that was a disaster, we shouldn’t do that again

author: Q
sentence: So, when you say you get there, what do you -

author: A
sentence: When I say get there

author: A
sentence: When you feel like, you go in with a perception of these are the big issues we’ve got to really deal with today

author: A
sentence: Sometimes there’s not much, but other times you think, God, how are we going to cover all this, we’ve got so much going on

author: A
sentence: And to come out afterwards and feel like, okay, maybe not everything, but we really did, made real progress

author: A
sentence: We’ve got a real plan now or we’ve got comfortable with what we’re doing there, et cetera

author: A
sentence: We now understand what management have been doing

author: A
sentence: They’re finally got us comfortable that that’s the right strategy, et cetera

author: A
sentence: I think, for me, a good board meeting is one where you’ve – and it might not always be the issues that you go into the meeting thinking are the big ones, you actually learn about some during the meeting, they can emerge

author: A
sentence: But it’s that feeling of making real progress on those and that you're on top of it

author: A
sentence: It doesn’t mean that you’ve solved them, but you know you’ve got a plan for them

author: A
sentence: I think the worst feeling is coming out and saying, shit, I know there’s a whole bunch of issues, but I don’t know if we’ve got whether these plans are adequate

author: A
sentence: And now I’ve got to start thinking about, can we wait for next meeting or I do I need to actually organise a teleconference and start chatting amongst the other directors and work out what we've got to do, to then have another chat with management

author: A
